judging the merits of multiple options and selecting one or more of them .

If the arrival at a choice includes more
complex motivators , cognition , instinct and feeling can become more intertwined . Most people regard having choices as a good thing , though a severely limited or artificially restricted choice can lead to discomfort with choosing , and possibly an unsatisfactory outcome . In contrast , a choice with excessively numerous options may lead to confusion , regret of the alternatives not taken , and indifference in an unstructured existence ; and the illusion that choosing an object or a course leads necessarily to control of that object or course can cause psychological problems .
